description: Polish Pumpkin Soup (Zupa z Dyni) is a creamy and flavorful autumn dish made with fresh pumpkin, warm spices, and topped with homemade grzanki (croutons) and cream. Perfect for a cozy dinner!
ingredients: [{"name": "medium sugar pumpkin", "units": "piece", "amount": 1}, {"name": "vegetable stock", "units": "cups", "amount": 4}, {"name": "light cream", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "paprika", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "nutmeg", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "brown sugar", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "white wine vinegar", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "pepper", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "sourdough bread", "units": "slices", "amount": 4}]
instructions: 1. Prepare the Pumpkin: Cut the pumpkin into cubes and cook in a pot with olive oil for 5-7 minutes. 2. Simmer the Soup: Add stock, spices, brown sugar, and vinegar to the pot. Simmer for 20 minutes until the pumpkin is tender. 3. Blend the Soup: Pur√©e the soup using an immersion blender or a regular blender until smooth. 4. Add Cream: Stir in the cream and heat for 2 more minutes. 5. Prepare the Grzanki: Toss cubed sourdough bread in olive oil and bake for 10-12 minutes until crispy. 6. Serve: Ladle the soup into bowls and top with grzanki, cream, and fresh parsley.
notes: For a spicier kick, add a pinch of chili flakes or smoked paprika. This soup is naturally gluten-free if you omit the grzanki or use gluten-free bread. The soup can be made with canned pumpkin, but fresh pumpkin provides a better texture and flavor.
